page.title: 03River Dart at Staverton
page.content: The river here is not navigable except for very small craft and the rafts that career down stream from Buckfastleigh to Totnes each year for local charities. There are two bridges ;Riverford and Staverton.The two weirs were built by salmon fishermen and the deep weir pools provide good sport. The rights here are leased to Blake Sports ,Totnes ,a daily ticket costing Â£5.The Water Bailiff tries to stop all unofficial fishing.Most of the year the river flows gently under Staverton Bridge but after winter snows it is often a raging torrent some 5 or 6 feet deeper with all sorts of debris bashing the piers of the bridge.Swans and many other water birds live on this reach.Occasionally we see the lovely Kingfisher flitting by. This is a place for naturalists and artists.
